articles.headline: Russia Hits Setbacks, as Flagship Sinks and E.U. Mulls Oil Ban
articles.snippet: Ukraine said it hit a Russian warship in the Black Sea with its own missiles, a damaging blow to Moscow, symbolically and militarily, if its claim is confirmed.
articles.abstract: Ukraine said it hit a Russian warship in the Black Sea with its own missiles, a damaging blow to Moscow, symbolically and militarily, if its claim is confirmed.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Russia’s faltering war against Ukraine suffered a pair of setbacks Thursday when the flagship of Russia’s Black Sea fleet sank after a catastrophic explosion and fire, as the European Union moved closer to an embargo on Russian oil imports.
articles.byline: By Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Richard Pérez-Peña

articles.headline: Musk Says He Has the Means to Buy Twitter, but Investors Aren’t So Sure
articles.snippet: Elon Musk could pledge his Tesla shares, borrow from banks or team up with private equity to raise the funds. Each option comes with caveats.
articles.abstract: Elon Musk could pledge his Tesla shares, borrow from banks or team up with private equity to raise the funds. Each option comes with caveats.
articles.lead_paragraph: People who try to take over companies typically go to great lengths to show they have put together the money they need to do it. Not Elon Musk.

articles.headline: Elon Musk, After Toying With Twitter, Now Wants It All
articles.snippet: The billionaire executive recently became one of the company’s largest shareholders. Now he says he wants to buy the whole thing and change how it handles speech.
articles.abstract: The billionaire executive recently became one of the company’s largest shareholders. Now he says he wants to buy the whole thing and change how it handles speech.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow for the latest updates on Elon Musk and Twitter.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac, Kate Conger and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: Fuel Prices Send Airfares Higher, but Travelers Seem Ready to Pay
articles.snippet: Supplies are not keeping up with demand, and costs may go higher, experts say.
articles.abstract: Supplies are not keeping up with demand, and costs may go higher, experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: A stunning rise in the cost of jet fuel has sent airfares soaring, and industry experts say they are likely to go higher. For now, though, travel-starved consumers seem more than willing to pay up.
articles.byline: By Niraj Chokshi and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: Cities Try to Turn the Tide on Police Traffic Stops
articles.snippet: Chiefs, prosecutors and lawmakers are rethinking the value, and the harm, of minor traffic stops like the one that ended in a man’s death in Grand Rapids.
articles.abstract: Chiefs, prosecutors and lawmakers are rethinking the value, and the harm, of minor traffic stops like the one that ended in a man’s death in Grand Rapids.
articles.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles is overhauling its traffic policing, aiming to stop pulling over cars — frequently with Black drivers — for trivial infractions like broken taillights or expired tags as a pretext to search for drugs or guns.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick, Steve Eder and Kim Barker

articles.headline: How Barnes & Noble Went From Villain to Hero
articles.snippet: To independent booksellers, the enormous chain was once a threat. Now it’s vital to their survival. And it’s doing well.
articles.abstract: To independent booksellers, the enormous chain was once a threat. Now it’s vital to their survival. And it’s doing well.
articles.lead_paragraph: After years on the decline, Barnes & Noble’s sales are up, its costs are down — and the same people who for decades saw the superchain as a supervillain are celebrating its success.

articles.headline: The Wolf of Crypto
articles.snippet: Jordan Belfort, the inspiration for “The Wolf of Wall Street,” is marketing himself as a cryptocurrency guru.
articles.abstract: Jordan Belfort, the inspiration for “The Wolf of Wall Street,” is marketing himself as a cryptocurrency guru.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: Twitter Counters a Musk Takeover With a Time-Tested Barrier
articles.snippet: The company is intent on fending off the billionaire’s bid to buy it in a deal that could be worth more than $40 billion.
articles.abstract: The company is intent on fending off the billionaire’s bid to buy it in a deal that could be worth more than $40 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Twitter does not want to become a plaything of the world’s richest person.
articles.byline: By Lauren Hirsch and Kate Conger
